Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: dvd

English

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (Received Pronunciation) IPA(key): /ˌdiː viː ˈdiː/
  • (General American) IPA(key): /ˌdi vi ˈdi/
  • Audio (Canada):(file)

Noun

[edit]

DVD (countable and uncountable, plural DVDs or DVD's)

  2. (countable) Initialism of digital video/versatile disc; an optical disc on which video is recorded in digital format, such as commercially-released movies and other video media.
    • 2007 August 15, James Martin, “Inside the spider's web”, in Alan Rusbridger, editor, The Guardian‎[1], London: Guardian News & Media, →ISSN, →OCLC, archived from the original on 31 August 2013:
      And, as if the guarantee of paradise were not sufficient, the museum also boasts a gift shop, where those so-inclined can purchase Hizbullah DVD's, key-chains, car-fresheners, and perfume.
    • 2024 March 27, J. Oliver Conroy, quoting Christina, “The film fans who refuse to surrender to streaming: ‘One day you’ll barter bread for our DVDs’”, in Katharine Viner, editor, The Guardian‎[2], London: Guardian News & Media, →ISSN, →OCLC, archived from the original on 27 March 2024:
      “We’ve lived it. We’ll never give up our collection. Ever. And maybe, one day, you’ll be the one to come and barter a loaf of bread for our DVD of Casino.”
  3. (uncountable, medicine) Initialism of dissociated vertical deviation.
    • 1999, Arthur L. Rosenbaum, Alvina Pauline Santiago, Clinical Strabismus Management, page 68:
      However, if postoperative anatomic intorsion is present, the patient may have DVD that was incorrectly diagnosed as IOOA and treated by IO muscle recessions.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • direct-to-DVD
  • DVD+R, DVD+RW, DVD+R DL
  • DVD Audio, audio DVD
  • DVD-R, DVD-RW, DVD-R DL
  • DVD-ROM, DVD-RAM
  • DVD Video, video DVD
  • HD-DVD

Related terms

[edit]
  • SACD
  • dualDisc
  • LD, CDDV, VCD, SVCD, BD

Translations

[edit]
digital video disc
  • Arabic: دِي فِي دِي m (dī fī dī)
  • Armenian: DVD, ԹՏՍ (TʻTS) (rare)
  • Azerbaijani: DVD
  • Bengali: ডিভিডি (bn) (ḍibhiḍi)
  • Burmese: ဒီဗီဒီ (dibidi)
  • Cebuano: dibidi (informal, slang)
  • Chinese:
    Mandarin: DVD (zh)
  • Dutch: dvd (nl) m, DVD (nl)
  • Esperanto: DVD
  • Estonian: DVD (et)
  • Finnish: DVD-levy (fi), DVD (fi)
  • French: DVD (fr) m, dévédé (fr) m (informal, slang)
  • Galician: DVD m, deuvedé m
  • Georgian: ციფრული ვიდეო დისკი (cipruli video disḳi)
  • German: DVD (de) f
  • Greek: ντιβιντί (ntivintí), DVD (el) n
  • Hebrew: DVD (he)
  • Hindi: डीवीडी (ḍīvīḍī)
  • Italian: DVD (it)
  • Japanese: ディーブイディー (dībuidī), ＤＶＤ (ja) (dībuidī)
  • Khmer: ឌីវីឌី (dii vii dii)
  • Korean: 디비디 (dibidi), 디뷔디 (dibwidi), DVD (ko)
  • Latin: disculus visionis digitalis m
  • Latvian: DVD
  • Lithuanian: DVD
  • Malay: DVD, cakera video digital
  • Persian: دی‌وی‌دی (di-vi-di)
  • Polish: DVD (pl) n
  • Portuguese: DVD (pt) m, devedê m
  • Romanian: DVD
  • Russian: ди-ви-ди́ m (di-vi-dí), DVD (ru) m, двд (dvd)
  • Spanish: DVD (es) m, dvd
  • Swedish: DVD (sv) c
  • Tagalog: dibidi (slang), DVD
  • Thai: ดีวีดี (dii-wii-dii)
  • Turkish: DVD (tr)
  • Ukrainian: ді-ві-ді́ (di-vi-dí), DVD
  • Urdu: ڈی وی ڈی (ḍīvīḍī)
  • Xibe: ᡩᡞ
    ᠸᡝᡞ
    ᡩᡞ     (di wei di)

[edit]

Azerbaijani

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

DVD

  1. DVD (optical disc)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of DVD
singular plural
nominative DVD DVD-lər
definite accusative DVD-ni DVD-ləri
dative DVD-yə DVD-lərə
locative DVD-də DVD-lərdə
ablative DVD-dən DVD-lərdən
definite genitive DVD-nin DVD-lərin
Possessive forms of DVD
nominative
singular plural
mənim (“my”) DVD-m DVD-lərim
sənin (“your”) DVD-n DVD-lərin
onun (“his/her/its”) DVD-si DVD-ləri
bizim (“our”) DVD-miz DVD-lərimiz
sizin (“your”) DVD-niz DVD-ləriniz
onların (“their”) DVD-si or DVD-ləri DVD-ləri
accusative
singular plural
mənim (“my”) DVD-mi DVD-lərimi
sənin (“your”) DVD-ni DVD-lərini
onun (“his/her/its”) DVD-sini DVD-lərini
bizim (“our”) DVD-mizi DVD-lərimizi
sizin (“your”) DVD-nizi DVD-lərinizi
onların (“their”) DVD-sini or DVD-lərini DVD-lərini

singular plural
mənim (“my”) DVD-mə DVD-lərimə

bizim (“our”) DVD-mizə DVD-lərimizə
sizin (“your”) DVD-nizə DVD-lərinizə
onların (“their”) DVD-sinə or DVD-lərinə DVD-lərinə

singular plural

sənin (“your”) DVD-ndə DVD-lərində
onun (“his/her/its”) DVD-sində DVD-lərində
bizim (“our”) DVD-mizdə DVD-lərimizdə
sizin (“your”) DVD-nizdə DVD-lərinizdə
onların (“their”) DVD-sində or DVD-lərində DVD-lərində

singular plural

French

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /de.ve.de/
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

DVD m (invariable)

  1. DVD (optical disc)

Noun

[edit]

DVD f (uncountable)

  1. (French politics) abbreviation of divers droite

German

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˌdeːfaʊ̯ˈdeː/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

DVD f (genitive DVD, plural DVDs)

  1. DVD (optical disc)
    Sollen wir für heute Abend eine DVD ausleihen?
    Should we rent a DVD for tonight?

Declension

[edit]
Declension of DVD [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die DVD die DVDs
genitive einer der DVD der DVDs
dative einer der DVD den DVDs
accusative eine die DVD die DVDs

Derived terms

[edit]
  • DVD-Spieler

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]

  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -deː

Noun

[edit]

DVD (plural DVD-k)

  1. DVD (optical disc)

[edit]

accusative DVD-t DVD-ket

non-attributive

Japanese

[edit]
Japanese Wikipedia has an article on:
DVD
Wikipedia ja

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English DVD.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (Tokyo) ディーブイディー [dìíbúídíꜜì] (Nakadaka – [5])[1]
  • IPA(key): [dʲiːbɯ̟idʲiː]

Noun

[edit]

DVD(ディーブイディー) • (dībuidī) 

  1. DVD (optical disc)

See also

[edit]
  • デジタル (dejitaru)
  • ビデオ (bideo)
  • ディスク (disuku)

References

[edit]
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Matsumura, Akira, editor (2006), 大辞林 [Daijirin] (in Japanese), Third edition, Tokyo: Sanseidō, →ISBN

Polish

[edit]
Polish Wikipedia has an article on:
DVD
Wikipedia pl

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • dvd

Etymology

[edit]

Unadapted borrowing from English DVD.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /di.viˈdi/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -i
  • Syllabification: D‧V‧D

Noun

[edit]

DVD n (indeclinable)

  1. (computing) DVD (optical disc on which video is recorded in digital format)
  2. (computing) DVD (drive in a computer that plays such discs)
  3. DVD player

Further reading

[edit]
  • DVD in Wielki słownik języka polskiego, Instytut Języka Polskiego PAN
  • DVD in Polish dictionaries at PWN

Noun

Swedish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • dvd

Etymology

[edit]

Unadapted borrowing from English DVD. First attested in 1995.

Noun

[edit]

DVD c

  1. DVD (optical disc)
    Synonym: DVD-skiva

Declension

[edit]
Declension of DVD
nominative genitive
singular indefinite DVD DVD:s
definite DVD:n
DVD:en 		DVD:ns
DVD:ens
plural indefinite DVD:er DVD:ers
definite DVD:erna DVD:ernas

References

[edit]
  • DVD in Svensk ordbok (SO)
  • DVD in Svenska Akademiens ordlista (SAOL)

Turkish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From English DVD.

Pronunciation

[edit]
This entry needs pronunciation information. If you are familiar with the IPA then please add some!

Noun

[edit]

DVD (definite accusative DVD'yi, plural DVD'ler)

  1. DVD (optical disc)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of DVD
singular plural
nominative DVD DVDler / DVD'ler
definite accusative DVD'yi DVDleri / DVD'leri
dative DVD'ye DVDlere / DVD'lere
locative DVD'de DVDlerde / DVD'lerde
ablative DVD'den DVDlerden / DVD'lerden
genitive DVD'nin DVDlerin / DVD'lerin
